Plants to Stay Open","summary":"

President Donald Trump is using the Defense Production Act to order meat and poultry plants hit hard by the coronavirus to stay open. More than a dozen plants have closed because of COVID-19 outbreaks among their workers. One union says 20 employees have died.

Infection as Meat Plants Ordered to Stay Open","summary":"

The Trump administration has ordered meat processing plants to remain open to stave off a shortage, but workers say close quarters at the plants put them at risk of contracting the coronavirus. NBC10’s Randy Gyllenhaal reports.

WASHINGTON, DC – APRIL 28: A man shops in the meat section at a grocery store, April 28, 2020 Washington, DC. Meat industry experts say that beef, chicken and pork could become scarce in the United States because many meat processing plants have been temporarily closed down due to the coronavirus pandemic. Tyson Foods took out a full page advertisement over the weekend in several major American newspapers, warning that the food supply chain is on the cusp of breaking. (Photo by Drew Angerer/Getty Images)

hours ago","date_string_short":"14 hours ago","eyebrow":{"link":"https://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/tag/pennsylvania/","label":"Pennsylvania","sponsored":false},"title":"Delco Barbershop Owner Plans to Reopen With or Without State’s Permission","summary":"

A Delaware County business owner says she plans to reopen her barbershop in less than two weeks despite the statewide restrictions. She told NBC10’s Steven Fisher if she doesn’t reopen soon she may never reopen again.

Poultry Processing Plants Hard","summary":"

A coronavirus problem in one part of Delaware might make it harder for you to find chicken at your grocery store — regardless of where you live. NBC10’s Tim Furlong checks on the status of poultry workers and the important food they produce for one of the state’s largest industries.

Murphy Calls Saliva Testing a Game Changer in Fight Against Coronavirus","summary":"

New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy called saliva testing a “game changer” in the fight against the novel coronavirus. NBC10’s Cydney Long went inside the Coriel Institutes Research Center in Camden to show us how it works.

hours ago","date_string_short":"20 hours ago","eyebrow":{"link":"https://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/tag/coronavirus/","label":"coronavirus","sponsored":false},"title":"Ways to Disinfect Your Home to Protect Against Coronavirus","summary":"

From a special fog to easy, at-home disinfectants, there are many ways to keep your house clear of viruses like Covid-19. NBC10’s Wendy Saltzman explains.

hours ago","date_string_short":"21 hours ago","eyebrow":{"link":"https://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/tag/coronavirus/","label":"coronavirus","sponsored":false},"title":"Appreciation for Fighter Jet Salute at Camden Hospital","summary":"

With masks on, healthcare workers from Cooper University Hospital in Camden had their eyes to the sky Tuesday afternoon to see a salute from the Blue Angels and Thunderbirds. NBC10’s Cydney Long was there for the moment.

hours ago","date_string_short":"22 hours ago","eyebrow":{"link":"https://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/tag/philadelphia/","label":"Philadelphia","sponsored":false},"title":"America Strong: Blue Angels and Thunderbirds Salute Philly Healthcare Workers With Flyover","summary":"

The joint flyover by Air Force and Navy aircraft took place over Pennsylvania, New Jersey, New York and Delaware, on Tuesday afternoon as the military flight demonstration squadrons focused on honoring front-line workers in some of the places hardest-hit by COVID-19.

Philly Testing Site","summary":"

In a South Philadelphia neighborhood, the Black Doctors’ Consortium has teamed up with local churches to provide COVID-19 testing. Testing is hard to find in some Philadelphia neighborhoods, and so these doctors are stepping up. NBC10’s Miguel Martinez-Valle reports.

Mother’s Day","summary":"

In-person Mother’s Day celebrations may be off the table this year for many Americans due to COVID-19 restrictions, but there are numerous options to celebrate. Options from buying mom a digital experience, sending mom wine and flowers or simply spending some time together.

28, 2020 1:09 pm","date_string_short":"Apr 28","eyebrow":{"link":"https://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/tag/meat-industry/","label":"Meat Industry","sponsored":false},"title":"Meat Supply Chains Disrupted by Coronavirus","summary":"

The coronavirus pandemic is taking an increasing toll on the nation’s meat suppliers. Last week Tyson’s largest pork plant announced it was suspending operations indefinitely after nearly 200 workers there fell ill. Tyson says millions of pounds of meat will disappear from store shelves until its plants can reopen safely.

28, 2020 10:46 am","date_string_short":"Apr 28","eyebrow":{"link":"https://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/tag/patriotic-flyover/","label":"patriotic flyover","sponsored":false},"title":"Look Up to the Sky for ‘America Strong’ Flyover for Front-Line Coronavirus Workers","summary":"

The U.S. Navy Blue Angels and the Air Force Thunderbirds flight teams will be soaring over South Jersey, Philadelphia and Delaware on Tuesday afternoon to pay honor to the health care workers and first responders on the front-line of the coronavirus pandemic. NBC10’s Miguel Martinez-Valle has the flight plan details.
